body_html: @iaroslav-ai Yepp, exactly. More precisely PCI-E passthrough which afaik isn't possible in Windows. And I agree, best way to go for the time being is to use Ubuntu. Be it on a USB stick or a second partition... However, as I mentioned in another issue here, dual booting is a pita. Especially if you're a hobbyist and want to do hobby-hopping between gaming and Tensowflowing every now and then. For this case - and I want to believe for others too - it'd be really awesome to have Tensorflow working natively and with GPU support on Windows.

body: @iaroslav-ai Yepp, exactly. More precisely PCI-E passthrough which afaik isn't possible in Windows. And I agree, best way to go for the time being is to use Ubuntu. Be it on a USB stick or a second partition... However, as I mentioned in another issue here, dual booting is a pita. Especially if you're a hobbyist and want to do hobby-hopping between gaming and _Tensowflowing_ every now and then. For this case - and I want to believe for others too - it'd be really awesome to have Tensorflow working natively and with GPU support on Windows.
